test-case.name: extexpr-1
test-case.description: A simple call to an extension expression, that should not be recognized (and thus ignored)

test-case.name: extexpr-2
test-case.description: An extension expression with no expression

test-case.name: extexpr-3
test-case.description: An pragma content containing the "#" symbol, which is ignored in an extension expression

test-case.name: extexpr-4
test-case.description: An extension expression, for which its QName can not be resolved to a namespace URI.

test-case.name: extexpr-5
test-case.description: An extension expression that contains more than one pragma, both of wihc are ignored

test-case.name: extexpr-6
test-case.description: A FLOWR expression that uses the same pragma twice and both times should be ignored.
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; for $x in (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {/works/employee[12]/overtime} return (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {/works/employee[12]/overtime}

test-case.name: extexpr-7
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a quantified expression ("every" operator).
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(every $x in (1,2,3) satisfies $x < 4)}

test-case.name: extexpr-8
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a quantified expression ("every" operator).
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(some $x in (1,2,3) satisfies $x = 2)}

test-case.name: extexpr-9
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a call to fn:true()

test-case.name: extexpr-10
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a call to fn:false()

test-case.name: extexpr-11
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "or" true expression ("or" operator)
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(fn:false() or fn:true())}

test-case.name: extexpr-12
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "or" false expression ("or" operator)
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(fn:false() or fn:false())}

test-case.name: extexpr-13
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "or" true expression ("and" operator)
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(fn:true() and fn:true())}

test-case.name: extexpr-14
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "or" false expression ("and" operator)
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {(fn:true() and fn:false())}

test-case.name: extexpr-15
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "if" true expression
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {if(fn:true()) then "passed" else "failed"}

test-case.name: extexpr-16
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an "if" false expression (returns "else" part of expression)
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {if(fn:false()) then "failed" else "passed"}

test-case.name: extexpr-17
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a "typeswitch" expression
test-case.test: declare namespace ns1 = "http://example.org/someweirdnamespace"; (# ns1:you-do-not-know-me-as-index #) {typeswitch ("A String") case $i as xs:decimal return "test failed" case $i as xs:integer return "test failed" case $i as xs:string return "test passed" default return "test failed" }

test-case.name: extexpr-18
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression uses the fn:not function.

test-case.name: extexpr-19
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression uses the fn:string-length function.

test-case.name: extexpr-20
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression uses the fn:count function.

test-case.name: extexpr-21
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is an addition operation.

test-case.name: extexpr-22
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a subtraction operation.

test-case.name: extexpr-23
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a multiplication operation.

test-case.name: extexpr-24
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a division operation (div operator).

test-case.name: extexpr-25
test-case.description: An extension expression for which the pragma is ignored and default expression is a division operation (idiv operator).

test-case.name: extexpr-26
test-case.description: Extension expression for missing space after pragma name.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-1
test-case.description: A pragma expression that never ends is syntactically invalid.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-2
test-case.description: A pragma expression that never starts is syntactically invalid.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-3
test-case.description: A simple pragma expression.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-4
test-case.description: A pragma expression cannot be in the empty namespace.

modified.change: Spec change in XQ 3.1: If the EQName is an unprefixed NCName, it is interpreted as a name in no namespace (and the pragma is therefore ignored).

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-4a
test-case.description: A pragma expression can be in the empty namespace in XQ 3.1.

modified.change: Spec change in XQ 3.1: If the EQName is an unprefixed NCName, it is interpreted as a name in no namespace (and the pragma is therefore ignored).

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-5
test-case.description: A pragma expression cannot be in the empty namespace even though a prefix is used.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-6
test-case.description: A pragma expression containing complex content.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-7
test-case.description: A fallback expression must be present when no supported pragmas are specified.

test-case.name: K-ExtensionExpression-8
test-case.description: A pragma expression containing many comments.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-1
test-case.description: An extension expression cannot be in an undeclared namespace.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-2
test-case.description: Whitespace isn't required if there is no pragma content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-3
test-case.description: Whitespace is allowed but not required if there is no pragma content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-4
test-case.description: Content looking like comments are not recognized as so in pragma content. asdad

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-5
test-case.description: Content looking like comments are not recognized as so in pragma content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-6
test-case.description: A single whitespace must separate pragma name and content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-7
test-case.description: A single whitespace must separate pragma name and content. content

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-8
test-case.description: A single whitespace must separate pragma name and content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-9
test-case.description: Whitespace between pragma-start and name cannot contain comments. a comment

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-10
test-case.description: Whitespace between pragma-start and name cannot contain comments.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-11
test-case.description: A single whitespace must separate pragma name and content.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-12
test-case.description: No whitespace is required between pragma content and name if the content is empty.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-13
test-case.description: A pragma expression that hasn't even specified a name, but has trailing whitespace.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-14
test-case.description: A pragma expression that hasn't even specified a name.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-15
test-case.description: A pragma expression with name and trailing whitespace, but without content and end.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-16
test-case.description: A pragma expression with name but without content and end.

test-case.name: K2-ExtensionExpression-17
test-case.description: Use four nested pragma expressions.

test-case.name: pragma-no-namespace-001
test-case.description: If pragma name is in no namespace, then the pragma is ignored.

test-case.name: pragma-no-namespace-002
test-case.description: If pragma name is in no namespace, then the pragma is ignored.

test-case.name: pragma-no-namespace-003
test-case.description: If pragma name is in no namespace, then the pragma is ignored.

test-case.name: pragma-no-namespace-004
test-case.description: If pragma name is in no namespace, then the pragma is ignored.

test-case.name: pragma-no-namespace-005
test-case.description: If pragma name is in no namespace, then the pragma is ignored.
